news_header: Healthy food costs more than unhealthy options, impacting low-income families.
news_text: A new analysis by the Food Foundation reveals that healthy food costs over double that of unhealthy options, with 1,000 calories of healthy food costing £8.80 compared to £4.30 for unhealthy food. The charity warns that low-income families are struggling to afford healthy diets, with 60% of households facing food insecurity reducing their fruit intake. The government plans to introduce a food strategy to address unhealthy diets, but the gap in food prices has widened, with healthy food prices rising by 21% in the last two years. The Food Foundation calls for government incentives to make healthy food more affordable.
